inference: Final Answer: $\boxed{455}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: In Pascal's triangle, the $k^\text{th}$ element in the row $n$ has the value $\binom{n}{k-1}.$ Row $15$ starts with $\binom{15}{0},$ $\binom{15}{1},$ $\binom{15}{2},$ $\binom{15}{3},$ so the fourth element is $$\binom{15}{3}=\frac{15!}{3!(15-3)!}=\frac{15\cdot14\cdot13}{3\cdot2\cdot1}=5\cdot7\cdot13=\boxed{455}.$$
